pageContext.claim: “We've pioneered ground-breaking therapies, reduced the -- And I'm tellin' you, we're down 85%, think of that. Think of that, down 85%.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to the case fatality rate, or CFR, is the percentage of deaths from the coronavirus among the confirmed cases, and he is correct that it appears to have fallen 85 percent since April. But he errs in attributing the drop to treatments or so-called "cures." There are other factors at work, including a shift toward lower-risk younger people and the fact that more widespread testing is picking up mild or asymptomatic coronavirus cases, according to experts interviewed by PolitiFact and factcheck.org.
